sen.j: 皇覚（こうかく、生没年未詳）は、平安時代後期の天台宗の僧。
sen.e: Kokaku (year of birth and death unknown) was a priest of Tendai Sect in the late Heian period.

sen.j: 歌人として著名な藤原基俊の子。
sen.e: He was a child of FUJIWARA no Mototoshi, well-known poet.

sen.j: 延暦寺に入り、大谷座主忠尋に師事。
sen.e: He entered Enryaku-ji Temple and studied under Otani zasu Chujin.

sen.j: 近江国東坂本椙生坊に住したことから、椙生坊法橋と号する。
sen.e: He took a second name of Sugiubo Hokkyo due to his having lived in Sugiubo, Higashi-Sakamoto, Omi Province.

sen.e: He called himself Sugiubo Hokkyo due to the fact that he resided in Sugiubo, Higashi-Sakamoto, Omi Province.

sen.j: 天台宗学、特に恵心流の探究に邁進し、後世において無動寺流、椙生流と称される一派の開祖となった。
sen.e: He strived to study of Tendai Sect, more especially, Eshin branch and became the founder of a group called Mudoji ryu or Sugiu ryu in later ages.
He was devoted to the study of the Tendai Sect, especially, the Eshin-ryu Branch, and became the founder of a branch called Mudoji-ryu or Sugiu-ryu in his later years.

sen.j: 門下には範源（一説に皇覚の実子とも伝わる）、皇円らを育て、著書としては『一代心地抄』、『五時口決』、『三十四箇事書』、『三十条口伝抄』、『椙生枕双紙』、『本懐抄』などを遺している。
sen.e: He educated Hangen (biological child of Kokaku according to one theory), Koen and so on as disciples and wrote "Ichidaishinchisho," "Goji Guketsu," "Sanjushikakotogaki," "Sanjujo Kudensho," "Sugiu makurasoshi," "Honkaisho" and so on.

He taught Hangen (rumored to be the biological child of Kokaku) and Koen among others, and authored works such as "Ichidaishinchisho," "Goji Guketsu," "Sanjushikakotogaki," "Sanjujo Kudensho," "Sugiu makurasoshi," and "Honkaisho."

sen.j: また藤原忠実に近侍し、その信仰上の顧問的立場にもあったと伝わる。
sen.e: He served FUJIWARA no Tadazane and is said to have also been in an advisory position for his master's religious belief.
He served FUJIWARA no Tadazane and is said to have also been a religious advisor to him.

sen.j: 忠実の厚い信任の下、宇治成楽院御堂供養や宇治平等院一切経会、あるいは忠実の息女である高陽院藤原泰子の葬儀において、中心的な役割を担ったことでも知られている。
sen.e: He is also known by having played a key role under the deep confidence of Tadazane at the time of Kuyo (put offerings to Buddha, scriptures and priests) at mi-do Hall of Uji Jorakuin, Issaikyoe at Uji-Byodoin Temple and the funeral of Kayano-in FUJIWARA no Taishi, a daughter of Tadazane.
sen.cmt: 「成楽院」の読み方不明ですが、とりあえず左の読みにしました。
sen.e: Winning the full confidence of Tadazane, he is also known to have played a key role in Kuyo (services held for the deceased) at Mi-do Hall of Uji Joraku-in Temple, in Issaikyoe at Uji Byodo-in Temple, and in the funeral of Kayano-in FUJIWARA no Taishi, a daughter of Tadazane.
